India guest country at Bourse of Paestum: Dedicated to archaeological tourism   
By Mario Masciullo, eTN Italy Correspondent | Aug 17, 2015 eTN   
ITALY (eTN) - The archaeological site of the ancient city of Paestum in Italy, a UNESCO World Heritage site since 1998, will be the location of the 2015 Mediterranean Tourism Archaeology Exchange, scheduled from October 29 to November 1. 
BMTA (Borsa Mediterranea del Turismo Archeologico) is the only international exhibition dedicated to the promotion of archaeological and cultural tourist destinations, attended by 120 exhibitors, representing 25 foreign countries. A workshop between Italian and foreign tour operators was selected by ENIT, Italy’s tourism agency. 
The area adjacent to the Temple of Ceres, the National Archaeological Museum, and the early Christian Basilica will host the different sections of the BMTA, including: Archeo-Virtual, the exhibition on the latest interactive and virtual multimedia technologies, and meetings with the protagonists in which the general public interact with the known television popularizers. 
The Bourse, now in its eighteenth edition, promotes cooperation among peoples through the exchange of experience, involving not only countries of the Mediterranean. The 2015 guest country will be India, a destination boasting a civilization that in the course of its five-thousand years was created and handed down to posterity great monuments. 
"For us,” underlines C. Gangadhar, Director of the Office of India Tourism in Italy, “it is very important to have effective visibility to present our archaeological heritage and the Bourse of Paestum is the only one in Italy dedicated to the archaeological tourism. India has an extraordinary, rich, vast, and varied cultural heritage with 32 UNESCO sites, of which 25 are cultural sites. Our National Archaeological Institute has selected 25 of the more than 3,700 sites for the project ‘Adarsh Smarak’ that in these areas it will ensure that many services - including wireless, transportation, and signs are in some cases innovative. There is also a communications campaign called ‘Swachh Bharat Abhiyan’ linked to the protection and safety with the slogan ‘Swachh Smarak: Swachh Bharat’ (monuments clean: clean India)," concluded C. Gangadhar. 
The City of Capaccio Paestum, the Province of Salerno, the Campania region, the Regional Secretariat for the region, and the Superintendence of Archaeology Campania are the promoters of the exchange. 
The Secretariat of the Campania Region, newly created as a result of the reform law with Ministerial Bonus Art, directed by the architect, Luca Maggi, will realize in the days of stock market events a video art within the project "Expo and territories," with a series of special openings and events related to the theme of food, which are particularly relevant coinciding with the closing days of the Expo Milano and divulged as well as the Bourse through Verybello.it, the site of Mibact.
